nodes.bodyText:
most changes are just this sort of thing.
occasionally you'll see "forEachRemaining()" which is what you have to do if there's no iterable available, only an iterator.
Cases like this have to be unpacked so you make the container and then add to it, rather than passing it into the utility method.
These are the "asMap()" changes which were manual (but still mostly just search & replace).
nodes.diffHunk:

         + " America/Los_Angeles America/Phoenix America/Denver America/Chicago America/Indianapolis"
         + " America/New_York";

nodes.bodyText: An example of where only an iterator is available.
thanks for the comments, that helps.
I could split these onto one-per-line, but left them like this so it's easier to see nothing important changed since lines line up in the diff.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -570,15 +570,14 @@ private void checkDuplicates(Map m) {
     Set<String> corrigendum = new TreeSet<String>(Arrays.asList(new String[] { "QE", "833",
         "830", "172" })); // 003, 419
 
-    private Map extraNames = CollectionUtilities.asMap(new String[][] {
-        { "BU", "Burma" }, { "TP", "East Timor" }, { "YU", "Yugoslavia" },
-        { "ZR", "Zaire" }, { "CD", "Congo (Kinshasa, Democratic Republic)" },
-        { "CI", "Ivory Coast (Cote d'Ivoire)" },
-        { "FM", "Micronesia (Federated States)" },
-        { "TL", "East Timor (Timor-Leste)" },
-        // {"155","Western Europe"},
-
-    });
+    private ImmutableMap<String, String> extraNames = ImmutableMap.<String, String>builder()
+        .put("BU", "Burma").put("TP", "East Timor").put("YU", "Yugoslavia")
